  <h2> <font size="-1"> com.lexalytics.salience</font> <br> Class Options.SentimentOptions</h2> 
  <pre>
java.lang.Object

   <dt>
    <pre>public class <b>Options.SentimentOptions</b>
     <dt>
      extends java.lang.Object
     </dt></pre>
   </dt>
  </dl>  
  <p> Base class for Salience options that are more specific to sentiment analysis </p>
  <p> </p>
  <p> </p>
  <hr> 
  <p>

  <a name="Options.SentimentOptions()">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> Options.SentimentOptions</h3> 
  <pre>
public <b>Options.SentimentOptions</b>()</pre> 
  <dl> 
  </dl> 
  <!-- ============ METHOD DETAIL ========== --> 
  <a name="method_detail">
   <!-- --></a> 
  <table border="1" width="100%" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" summary=""> 
   <tbody>
    <tr bgcolor="#CCCCFF" class="TableHeadingColor"> 
     <th align="left" colspan="1"><font size="+2"> <b>Method Detail</b></font></th> 
    </tr> 
   </tbody>
  </table> 
  <a name="setSentimentDictionary(java.lang.String)">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> setSentimentDictionary</h3> 
  <pre>
public void <b>setSentimentDictionary</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;dictionaryFile)
                            throws <a href="../../../com/lexalytics/salience/SalienceException.html" title="class in com.lexalytics.salience">SalienceException</a></pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    Loads the phrases from the specified sentiment dictionary (HSD) for use in sentiment analysis. 
    <ul>
     <li>Min/Max range: n/a</li> 
     <li>Default value: none</li>
    </ul> This option clears out any pre-existing sentiment phrases and weights from previous HSD files, and uses only the phrases and sentiment weights in the HSD file specified. 
    <p> </p>
   </dd>
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Parameters:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code>dictionaryFile</code> - String providing path to HSD file to use as sole source of sentiment phrases 
     </dd>
     <dt>
      <b>Throws:</b> 
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code><a href="../../../com/lexalytics/salience/SalienceException.html" title="class in com.lexalytics.salience">SalienceException</a></code>
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <a name="AddSentimentDictionary(java.lang.String)">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> AddSentimentDictionary</h3> 
  <pre>
public void <b>AddSentimentDictionary</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;dictionaryFile)
                            throws <a href="../../../com/lexalytics/salience/SalienceException.html" title="class in com.lexalytics.salience">SalienceException</a></pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    Appends another sentiment dictionary (HSD) containing phrases to consider in sentiment analysis. 
    <ul>
     <li>Min/Max range: n/a</li> 
     <li>Default value: none</li>
    </ul> Adding another sentiment dictionary adds phrases and associated sentiment weights from the HSD specified, overriding any matching phrases from any previously loaded sentiment dictionary while retaining any from previously loaded HSD that are unique. 
    <p> </p>
   </dd>
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Parameters:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code>dictionaryFile</code> - String providing path to HSD file to append as source of sentiment phrases 
     </dd>
     <dt>
      <b>Throws:</b> 
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code><a href="../../../com/lexalytics/salience/SalienceException.html" title="class in com.lexalytics.salience">SalienceException</a></code>
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <a name="AddSentimentModel(java.lang.String)">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> AddSentimentModel</h3> 
  <pre>
public void <b>AddSentimentModel</b>(java.lang.String&nbsp;sentimentModel)
                       throws <a href="../../../com/lexalytics/salience/SalienceException.html" title="class in com.lexalytics.salience">SalienceException</a></pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    Specifies a sentiment model to use for model-based sentiment analysis. 
    <ul>
     <li>Min/Max range: n/a</li> 
     <li>Default value: none</li>
    </ul> 
    <p> </p>
   </dd>
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Parameters:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code>sentimentModel</code> - String providing path to additional sentiment model to include in model-based sentiment analysis 
     </dd>
     <dt>
      <b>Throws:</b> 
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code><a href="../../../com/lexalytics/salience/SalienceException.html" title="class in com.lexalytics.salience">SalienceException</a></code>
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <a name="ClearSentimentModels()">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> ClearSentimentModels</h3> 
  <pre>
public void <b>ClearSentimentModels</b>()
                          throws <a href="../../../com/lexalytics/salience/SalienceException.html" title="class in com.lexalytics.salience">SalienceException</a></pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    Clears all current sentiment models from model-based sentiment analysis. 
    <ul>
     <li>Min/Max range: n/a</li> 
     <li>Default value: none</li>
    </ul> 
    <p> </p>
   </dd>
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Throws:</b> 
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code><a href="../../../com/lexalytics/salience/SalienceException.html" title="class in com.lexalytics.salience">SalienceException</a></code>
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <a name="SetSentimentThresholds(float, float)">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> SetSentimentThresholds</h3> 
  <pre>
public void <b>SetSentimentThresholds</b>(float&nbsp;negativeMaximum,
                                   float&nbsp;positiveMinimum)
                            throws <a href="../../../com/lexalytics/salience/SalienceException.html" title="class in com.lexalytics.salience">SalienceException</a></pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    Sets the boundaries for document sentiment to be considered neutral 
    <ul>
     <li>Min/Max range: MAX_FLOAT</li> 
     <li>Default value: negativeMaximum = -0.45, positiveMaximum = 0.5</li>
    </ul> By default, the negative sentiment count for collection documents will represent documents scoring -0.45 or lower. And by default, the positive sentiment count will represent collection documents scoring 0.5 or higher. 
    <br>Modifying the thresholds will shift the counts of documents considered positive, negative, or neutral accordingly. 
    <p> </p>
   </dd>
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Parameters:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code>negativeMaximum</code> - The maximum sentiment value for a document to be considered negative in collection analysis
     </dd>
     <dd>
      <code>positiveMinimum</code> - The minimum sentiment value for a document to be considered positive in collection analysis 
     </dd>
     <dt>
      <b>Throws:</b> 
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code><a href="../../../com/lexalytics/salience/SalienceException.html" title="class in com.lexalytics.salience">SalienceException</a></code>
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <hr> 
  <a name="setUsePolarityModel(boolean)">
   <!-- --></a>
  <h3> setUsePolarityModel</h3> 
  <pre>
public void <b>setUsePolarityModel</b>(boolean&nbsp;polarity)
                         throws <a href="../../../com/lexalytics/salience/SalienceException.html" title="class in com.lexalytics.salience">SalienceException</a></pre> 
  <dl> 
   <dd>
    <b><i>Added in Salience 5.1</i></b>
    <br> Includes a measure of whether a sentence 'looks' like the sort of sentence that usually communicates sentiment in analysis. 
    <ul>
     <li>Min/Max range: true/false</li> 
     <li>Default value: false</li>
    </ul> This option controls use of the sentiment polarity model introduced in Salience 5.1. When using the polarity model, a phrase such as "Good morning, America" will not be given positive sentiment as it is just a statement. 
    <p> </p>
   </dd>
   <dd>
    <dl> 
     <dt>
      <b>Parameters:</b>
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code>polarity</code> - Boolean flag controlling use of polarity model 
     </dd>
     <dt>
      <b>Throws:</b> 
     </dt>
     <dd>
      <code><a href="../../../com/lexalytics/salience/SalienceException.html" title="class in com.lexalytics.salience">SalienceException</a></code>
     </dd>
    </dl> 
   </dd> 
  </dl> 
  <!-- ========= END OF CLASS DATA ========= -->
